frames.dialogueText: Have you ever felt that there was not enough adventure in your life?

I haven't.
I'm perfectly fine living a normal life.
Can't say I'm particulary good at anything. I'm more of this average guy that no one notices in class.
I don't go to any clubs or I have no particular hobbies so it's no wonder no one really notices me.
Some might say that it's a very boring life but I quite like it. Nothing you need to do and no one expects anything of you.
At least, that's what my life was like until that thing happened...
It was at the end of high school. Most students were busy preparing for preparing going to university.
Unsuprisingly, I hadn't made up my mind of what I wanted to do with my life.
I was thinking about a few places where I could get some basic education and postpone this for later.
Not that exciting, but what can you do?
Well now it so happened that a great opportunity presented itself to me that evening.
Some men from the government had apparently figured out that I had a certain talent they were looking for.
They offered me a well paid job for two years as well as the ability to enter whatever school I ever wanted after that.
But of course there was a catch. The work they offered was dangerous but they weren't allowed to tell me more than that.
Considering how my future looked right now I didn't really have much to loose so I figured I could do it.
And I was also curious about this "talent" I had that they needed. Maybe this was a chance for me to get recognized.
The job started a week after I graduted high school and the days went by quite fast without anything special happening.
So the day came when it was time to depart for this new job.
First I had to go by train quite far and when I arrived, they picked me up at the station.
They even blindfolded me so I wouldn't know the exact location of it.
I'm not sure how long we traveled but when we got close the location I was allowed to remove the blindfold.
There in the distance was what looked like some kind of building complex and that's were we were heading.
Welcome to outpost Epsilon, one of the men said to me. This is where you're going to wor for the next two years.k
You aren't the only new one, there are about 50 of you this time.

50!?
Just how big is this place?
I had so many questions I wanted answers to but before I could ask them we arrived at the location.
We entered through one of the main door and was greeted by corridors and rooms everywhere.
I was led through several corridors towards the gathering place.
On our we there, we met several people which looked to be armed for some reason.
Maybe not the most reassuring sight to see when you arrive at your new job.
We arrived outside the designated room and the men told me to wait inside until everyone had arrived.
I took a step inside and found myself inside what looked to be a classroom.
There were about ten other people in my age in the classroom already, waiting for the rest by the looks of it.
No one really looked eager to start talking so there was awkwardly quiet in the room. 
Can't say I blame them as I didn't really feel like striking up a conversation either.
After waiting for about 30 minutes five more people arrived to the classroom.
After them, another person dressed in uniform entered and walked up to the blackboard and started introducing themself.
Welcome to HDMI division Epsilon! I assume you all have a lot of questions you when answered and I'll do my best explaining it to you.
Here at HDMI you will learn how to fight in order to protect yourself and humanity from attacks.
We're going to be using something called "Kanji" by channeling energy into them to use them as weapons against enemies.
There are a lot of different Kanji you can use so everyone will be able to find some they like.
There will be some time until you're ready to join in the battles so don't worry if it sounds scary to you.
So what are we actually fighting you might ask. And believe me, it's not something you've heard of before.
The easiest way to describe them would be to call them monsters. We call them "Darklings" though so I will hereby refer to them as that.
There are certain places in the world where Darklings can appear and threathen us. This is just one of many places.
Because of that, we've built this base here to prevent them from attacking everyone.
As you can see, we've doing fine as there casualties have been kept at a minimum due to the training you will receive.
There will be more explanations of the Darklings later on in your training so I'll move on to the next topic.
Each of you will be assigned to a three-man group in which you will operate at all time.
That essentially means during training and in battle.
Each member of the group will have a different role which complements each other.Leader, shaman and support.
You will each take a placement test tomorrow in order to see which role will suit you the best.
And don't worry about the test. It's not too difficult, it's just for the placement.
So there's a placement test, huh?
Now that I think about it, which of these role would be a good fit for me? Can't say I know right now.
I get what a leader and support does but what does a shaman do?
You will hear more about the roles tomorrow at the tests so save the questions for then.
All right. I think that will suffice as explanation for what you will be doing here.
What's left now is to take care of the administration. Where you will sleep and show you around the place.
First of all, we've prepared rooms for all of you...

*slam*
Suddenly, a man clad in uniform bursted into the room.

Captain! It's an emergency!
We're under attack!

Where are they coming from?
Quickly now, there's not much time!
They suddenly appeared in the east section of the maiin building. We weren't expecting them to appear there so we were taken by surprise.
A lot of people have been injured and several Darklings have managed to get past us.

But that means no one here is safe!
Okay everyone! We need to get out of here to somewhere safe!
A lot of people looked as confused as I but given the situation we didn't have much of a choice but to follow orders.
We hurried out after the teacher out of the classroom.
We need to get to the west section so we can avoid the Darklings!
We followed him through countless corridors towards the west section of the building.
It took a surprisingly long time to get to the west section as we still weren't there.
Yes? What's the situation?
The teacher was on what looked like a phone, talking to someone.

But that's where we are now!
Are you certain!?
Okay. I'll see what I can do.
Everyone, it seems there are several Darklings which have managed to get to the west section as well.
I keep them off with the help of my team mates so run for the west section where others will take care of you.
After a short moment of confusion someone took the lead and headed towards the west section following the signs on the walls.
I could only hope that everyone would arrive there safely.
But of course we weren't that lucky.
Turning around a corner we came face to face with one of the "Darklings".
People started to panic and the Darkling jump forward and hit one of the people, striking them down with a single blow.
I decided to take one of the other ways from there and hope I would be able to get to the west section anyways.
I heard screams coming from behind me but I was too scared to look over my sholder and kept running.
Unfortunately, I ended up in a dead end as I didn't have the ID card to go any further.
When I turned around I saw another Darkling just about to turn the corner at the end of the corridor.
I panicked and threw myself into the closest room hoping that the Darkling hadn't noticed me.
I ended up in another classroom and quickly blocked the door with one of the chairs.
It didn't work and the Darkling broke through the door.
I was standing as far away as possible and realised I one had one chance to get away.
If I could get the Darkling away from the door I might be able to dash past it.
I collected myself I waited for the moment when the Darkling would get closer to me and leave the an opening at the door.

There!
I saw my chance dashed past it.
Unfortunately, I wasn't fast enough and the Darkling managed to knock me into the desks in the room.
Pain seared through my body and I realised that running away now would be nigh impossible.
The Darkling raised its arm ready to strike and then everything went black as I can't recall anything more.
Probably because I died at that moment.
...You will each take a placement test tomorrow in order to see which role will suit you the best.
And don't worry about the test. It's not too difficult, it's just for the placement...
He's finally finished with the explanations. Was there really this much you had to tell us this early?
But I guess some people here doesn't know yet so it's not that surprising.
Hope the people in my team won't drag me down. I can't afford to fail now.
If only my brother wasn't already working here and doing so well then I might have not needed to do this.
So I really didn't have a choice so I just gonna have to do my best.

*slam*
Suddenly one of the soldiers came into the room.

Captian! It's an emergency!
We're under attack!

A Darklings attack?
And by the looks of it they were not prepared for it.
But I might be able to use this to my advantage as this might be my chance to show what I can do.
Okay everyone! We need to get out of here to somewhere safe!
Everyone hurried out of the classroom following the instructor but I ended up staying.
I think he said that the Darklings appeared at the east section so I should try to head there.
If I manage to defeat one on my own on my first day, they have to put me at the top of the class.
Finding the east section was not difficult as there were signs all of the place pointing in different directions.
But I never got that far as I stumbled upon a Darkling before that.
It was much scarier in real life than what I imagined so I lost my composure because of the sudden encounter.
But I had to defeat it. I had come this far and if I didn't succeed than I would get punished for going off on my own.
Unfortunately, a shaman just arrived at the scene and defeated the Darkling before I had a chance to do anything.

What are you doing here!?
This is no place for a civilian. Get to safety in the west section!
I was about to argue back when another Darkling appeared and tried to attack me.
The shaman managed to get me out of the way and strike down the darkling.
Go! Now!
Looks like I won't be able to defeat a Darkling on my own if it continues like this. I should take his advice and not get myself killed.
I might be able to explain why I wasn't with the rest of the group by telling them I got lost and got rescued by one of the shamans.
I hurried back towards the west section following the signs on the walls.
Given the size of the building it took quite some time to get there and there wasn't anything special on the way.
Not even any dead bodies or Darklings which would signify that I was on the right track.
When I was almost there I heard some screams close by.
I hid behind a corner and heard some people run past towards the west section followed by some Darklings.
I had to go the same way if I wished to reached the west section so I had no choice but to follow them.
I waited until they had disappeared around the corner before I started following them.
On the way I found several people dead. Probably killed by the Darklings.
I tried to not look too closely on them as I hurried past them.
Just when I went past a corridor I saw that a Darkling was trying to force its way through a door.
I figured that there was someone in there that it was trying to get to.
At first I wasn't that keen on actually approaching it considering my previous encounter with a Darkling.
But then I suddenly had a feeling that I had to go into that room and help the one inside.
I approached the room which the Darkling had already entered and heard what could have been the sound of someone getting thrown.
I looked in and saw a Darkling attacking someone and I attacked it in order to save that person.
I defeated the Darkling but I was too late. The person there inside was already dead.
But even then, I could still feel their presence lingering which made me realise something amazing.
I'm a shaman!
It took some time before I came to again.
Everything felt strange though for some reason. Things didn't look as they did before.
Then I remebered that I was attacked by that monster.
Am I dead? I think I was killed by that monster that was hunting me.
But if that's true, why can I still think about this?
I didn't have time to think more than that before a sudden force pulled me back to reality.
It took a while before I realised where I was.
But this is the classroom I just was in. Does that mean that the monster didn't kill me.
But then I saw that one of those monsters was still here in the classroom looking at something lying in the corner.
But there was another person in the room as well which the monster hadn't seen yet.
The person looked like they where trying to sneak up on the monster.
Then they looked at me with a surprised look for some reason.
They left the room again and signed me to follow.
I can't believe it actually worked. So this is how they look. Well they are originally humans so I shouldn't be surprised they look normal.
What do you mean look normal? However I look at them they doesn't look normal to me.

Oh?
You mean you haven't realised it yet?
I guess that is normal for spirits to take some time before they get all of their memory back again.
So it's not the monsters you're talking about. Is there a spirit here as well?
You could say that. Have you even looked at yourself yet?
With everything happening around here I can't say I've thought about looking at myself like that.
When I looked at myself I realised that my body was kinda levitating a bit above the ground!
I'm levitating! What's going on!?
That's because you are a spirit right now. You can just float around instead of walking.
It might not look like that to you, but to me you look a bit transparent and glowing which is why I realised you were a spirit.

Am I a spirit?
Does that mean I'm dead as well?
Yes it does unfortunately. I you look into the classroom you can ssee your body lying there.
I really didn't want to believe that but I had to make sure that they were telling me the truth so I looked into the classroom.
There, in the corner behind the monster I saw my own lifeless body lying in the corner of the room.
Everything was so surreal that I couldn't help myself from letting out a surprised gasp.
The monster turned around at the sound and started looking straight at me for some reason.
Can they also see monsters?
The monster started walking towards me and I realised that it was looking straight at me.

Idiot!
Don't just stand there!
Do something!
I wasn't entirely sure what I was supposed to do but I had to do something to stop that monster.
You're a spirit now so you've gained new powers. Help me fight this things off!
And then they pulled out a small thing with a weird symbol on it.
Then a fire ball shot out from that thing and hit the monster.
Unfortunately, it didn't seem to face it by the slightest.

Come on now! You need to help out here using your spirit powers! 

I can't do this on my own!
Just focus on channeling your power into an attack.
Okay. I'll try.

I had no idea what that meant but I had to try.
I tried channeling my power to use as an attack.
The monster was slowly getting closer while being bombarded by those fire balls.
I don't know how but somehow I managed to use my spirit powers to create an attack.
My attack hit at the same time as the time as the fire balls and the monster was defeated!

That was great! We did it!
We defeated the Darkling!
So what's going on now? What are those monsters and why are they attacking us?
Didn't you listen to the explanation you got from the instructor?
Well, yeah. But...

Then you know what they are.
I think you have other concerns right now, being a spirit and all.

Oh right!
I'm a spirit now!
Is that why I got these new spirit powers?
That is only partly true. Yes, you do get other powers when you are a spirit but that by itself is not enough.
As you are dead you have no way to affect the normal world anymore. So you need a shaman to do that.
And I am actually a shaman so I can channel you so you can help me fight the monsters.
So does that mean that I won't be able to do anything unless you're here to channel me?

Yeah, it does.
But it doesn't have to be bad. We're stronger  when we're together as you just saw!

Come on!
We need to get to the others before we get attacked by any more Darklings.
I guess I won't have a choice now as a spirit. If I want to be able to do something I'm gonna have to stick to that shaman.
I hope I can figure out what's going on at the same time.

This is the end of the prologue for the prototype. 
The rest of the story is available in the full game.
